Again. This is not a bug. That GitHub download issue. We can't fix issue. 

We use submodule, GitHun download can't support. You could find the notice in release page.

Look like a very positive test result. But 6.0.0 alpha is ready to go, so this may belong to beta release.
@ni-ze could you commit a new test case for inherit scenario, which is why we begin this pr at the beginning. Don't change the existing ones, submit a new one please.

I do have a test case for inherit scenario, but it is in my repository: 
https://github.com/ni-ze/TestCaseForInherit.git
Use this case can re-appear the bug we discuess at the beginning.

I am sure you have tested on your own. But I want to be sure official test cases include this scenario. So, you need to submit a new one to https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases

Cn test guide is here https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases/blob/master/docs/how-to-write-a-plugin-testcase-cn.md
@ascrutae if you have time, could help on this test. Codeslook good to me.
OK.

Ci haven't reported there is test case failure. Couls you explain why need this pr? What happens?

In fact, no error was reported for this test. I just think the test info here should be modified so that the developers will know the data structure clearly when they receive the warning info through webhook.
:-P
Sure. This should harm nothing. :)
We already have this but in different way. See here https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Setting-override.md
@wu-sheng Yes, I saw that, it can solve my problem, but why not support another, maybe more recommended way? For example, like jacoco https://www.eclemma.org/jacoco/trunk/doc/agent.html
I think no one is blocking things like this. Just no one contribute this. If you want, welcome.
In Apache, we don't block things like this. Just need contributor brings new feature to the code base. So, do if you like.

> I think the config sample_n_per_3_secs is the absolute amount, right?

Yes.

> We don't hope produce much more data in the pro env, just enough is ok. Of course we couldn't use the default config(as many as possible), the data is so huge.

That is a tricky question. Because, in a high throughput system, 10~50 is enough. But I will notice, if there is low payload endpoint in such a high throughput system, you have no chance to trace or see it.

So, how many samples per 3 secs based on your storage and network capabilities. For me, I prefer 100, which means 30 tps for each instance. But that effect the metric accurate, be careful.

The data depends on your agent time zone and time. Try to set your os time right.
but after i reset the os time and clear all the data and log. it still the same.
You need restart your application. Then easy way, write a java app to read time, system current millionseconds. See what is happening. Linux has a lot of ways to set time. Make sure Jvm could read it
Another tip, endpoint relation scope will become optional at backend too. @peng-yongsheng
cc @chidaodezhongsheng If you are trying to make php working in 6, I prefer you should know this. And I really look forward your new php tracer release.

i already resolved it. it is not the os problem, this issue is because install 2 kinds jdk. i need to add 
-Duser.timezone=Asia/Shanghai
into the JAVA_OPTS of the file: 
collectorService.sh
webappService.sh
That is one way. You could set time zone in os too. Many ways to do this

no. in my case , the second jdk can't able to read the os time zone. i don't know why .
but i think, maybe you can add the time zone into the setting properties file. 
it might be very helpful~
No, we can't. Because we have users in global. We don't know the right time zone
you can default read the os time zone . but have some options in the configuration file
What is this request for?
Different UI and backend for the different namespace.
I am not familiar with Hystrix, could you explain more about the option (1). What is `registerSWHystrixConcurrencyStrategyWrapper` do? Look like reset the old way?
@ascrutae Could you take part in this? too.

The header just like below, it only happended while calling dubbo service from dubbo consumer through rest protocol, dubbo protocol is OK.

the comma present like queryVehicleloadUnloadTasksByLineRequireId(long,int,String), I just replace it with colon, it's fine now. 

36.181.15417549869400000|2|36|36|7|#services/com.sf.fvp.data.server.service.IVehicleLoadUnloadTaskRestService.queryVehicleloadUnloadTasksByLineRequireId(long,int,String)|#services/com.sf.fvp.data.server.service.IVehicleLoadUnloadTaskRestService.queryVehicleloadUnloadTasksByLineRequireId(long,int,String)|36.181.15417549869400001

A more detailed example:

## Current

1. A custom HystrixConcurrencyStrategy (named Custom) wants to wrap the current HystrixConcurrencyStrategy, so it calls `HystrixPlugin#getConcurrencyStrategy`
2. `HystrixPlugin#getConcurrencyStrategy` loads the default implementation (called Default)
3. HystrixConcurrencyStrategyInterceptor intercepts this method, wraps and caches the result (called SW), at this point:
    - Field `HystrixPlugin.concurrencyStrategy`: Default
    - Intercepted result: SW[Default]
4. Custom wraps SW[Default] with delegate pattern and registers itself with `HystrixPlugin#reset` and `HystrixPlugin#registerConcurrencyStrategy`, at this point:
    - Field `HystrixPlugin.concurrencyStrategy`: Custom[SW[Default]]
5. A new HystrixCommand is created, and get the current implementation by `HystrixPlugin#getConcurrencyStrategy`. Also HystrixConcurrencyStrategyInterceptor intercepts this method, and returns the cached result, at this point:
    - Field `HystrixPlugin.concurrencyStrategy`: Custom[SW[Default]] (correct)
    - Intercepted result: SW[Default] (wrong, Custom is lost)

## Option 1

1. A custom HystrixConcurrencyStrategy (named Custom) wants to wrap the current HystrixConcurrencyStrategy, so it calls `HystrixPlugin#getConcurrencyStrategy`
2. `HystrixPlugin#getConcurrencyStrategy` loads the default implementation (called Default)
3. HystrixConcurrencyStrategyInterceptor intercepts this method, wraps and register itself(called SW), at this point:
    - Field `HystrixPlugin.concurrencyStrategy`: SW[Default]
    - Intercepted result: SW[Default]
4. Custom wraps SW[Default] with delegate pattern and registers itself with `HystrixPlugin#reset` and `HystrixPlugin#registerConcurrencyStrategy`, at this point:
    - Field `HystrixPlugin.concurrencyStrategy`: Custom[SW[Default]]
5. A new HystrixCommand is created, and get the current implementation by `HystrixPlugin#getConcurrencyStrategy`. Also HystrixConcurrencyStrategyInterceptor intercepts this method, but do nothing, at this point:
    - Field `HystrixPlugin.concurrencyStrategy`: Custom[SW[Default]] (correct)
    - Intercepted result: Custom[SW[Default]] (correct)

@Yuanxiangz sorry for late. if `UNKNOWN.png` didn't exist, the `cytoscape.js` can't render the whole graph. In short, `UNKNOWN.png` is the root cause.

v6 fixing this issue will be released next week.
